alert.note: Alert for Burnett (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 21 at 2:42PM CDT until August 23 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM CDT TUESDAY... ...HEAT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory on Tuesday, heat index values up to 105 expected. For the Heat Advisory on Wednesday, heat index values up to 97 expected. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Pine County. In Wisconsin, Burnett County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the St. Croix Band in Burnett County and the Mille Lacs Band, Lena Lake and, Hinckley areas. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory on Tuesday, from 11 AM to 9 PM CDT Tuesday. For the Heat Advisory on Wednesday, from noon to 9 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Localized heat index values in far southern Pine and Burnett Counties may reach up to 110 degrees. Overnight lows on Tuesday night into Wednesday morning will be cooling only to the low to mid 60s.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
